title: Empanada Dough Recipe
description: Make empanada dough with this basic recipe, then fill it with your favorite filling: pork, beef, chicken, cheese, shrimp — the sky's the limit!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Appetizers and Snacks Pastries Empanadas Empanada Dough 3.6 (55) 45 Reviews 20 Photos This basic empanada dough can be filled with any type of filling, then fried or baked. Submitted by lola Updated on April 18, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 20 20 20 20 Prep Time: 20 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 24 Yield: 24 empanada disks Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 24 servings 2 cups all-purpose flour ⅓ cup white sugar ½ teaspoon salt ½ cup water 1 large egg yolk 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour for dusting 2 tablespoons butter, melted Directions Whisk 2 cups flour, sugar, and salt together in a bowl until well blended. Make a well in the center. Whisk water and egg yolk together in a small bowl until smooth; pour into the well and mix to form a stiff dough. Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes. Roll dough with a rolling pin until thin, dusting with flour as needed to prevent sticking. Brush melted butter over top and roll dough into a log. Cut the log crosswise into about 24 slices. Roll each slice into a disk. To Make the Empanadas: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Fill each empanada disk with about 1 tablespoon of your favorite filling. (Try lola's recipe for Empanada Pork Filling to make Filipino-style empanadas.) Fold the disk over the filling into a half-moon and seal firmly. Place empanadas onto a foil-lined baking sheet and brush the tops with beaten egg white. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 30 minutes. I Made It Print 170 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 62 Calories 1g Fat 11g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 24 Calories 62 % Daily Value * Total Fat 1g 2% Saturated Fat 1g 4% Cholesterol 11mg 4% Sodium 56mg 2% Total Carbohydrate 11g 4% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 3g Protein 1g 3% Calcium 3mg 0% Iron 1mg 3% Potassium 13mg 0% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Empanada Dough 01 of 20 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 20 Photo by  RobCat0717 05/05/2020 03 of 20 Photo by  mich 04/08/2020 04 of 20 Photo by  Kalina 04/04/2020 I used a whole egg in the mixture and only 1 tbsp of sugar. I made twelve and stuffed them with potatoes, cheese and taco seasoned ground beef. Before I baked them I coated the pan in butter and the tops of each empanada with egg white and butter. Baked for 15 minutes, turned them all over, and baked for another 15 minutes. They came out amazingly crispy! The dough tastes great with the butter and cheese. I would make these again in a pan cooked with oil to see the difference! 05 of 20 Photo by  ShellyRO 09/30/2019 06 of 20 Photo by  Chonta Wilcox 07/16/2019 07 of 20 Photo by  Chonta Wilcox 07/16/2019 08 of 20 Photo by  Vladimir Alexander 08/16/2018 09 of 20 Photo by  Evan P. 12/14/2017 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Classic Beef Empanadas 6 Ratings Quick Vegetarian Picadillo Empanadas 1 Rating Quince Empanadas 1 Rating Empanadas Salteñas 1 Rating Argentinean-Inspired Beef Mini Empanadas 2 Ratings Beef Empanadas with Olives and Raisins 1 Rating Carbonada Criolla Mini Empanadas Our 14 Best Empanada Recipes Fried Beef Empanadas with Olives and Sofrito 1 Rating Empanadas de Pollo (Easy Chicken Empanadas) 8 Ratings Chicken Empanadas 17 Ratings Plantain Empanadas Chinese Chicken Wings 90 Ratings Siopao (Filipino Steamed Dumplings) 25 Ratings Chef John's Chinese Scallion Pancakes 42 Ratings Lumpia 13 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: lola
instructions: Whisk 2 cups flour, sugar, and salt together in a bowl until well blended. Make a well in the center.;Whisk water and egg yolk together in a small bowl until smooth; pour into the well and mix to form a stiff dough.;Transfer the dough to a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes. Roll dough with a rolling pin until thin, dusting with flour as needed to prevent sticking. Brush melted butter over top and roll dough into a log.;Cut the log crosswise into about 24 slices. Roll each slice into a disk.
